meanings.definition: A specimen selected as the type of a species when the original type is lost or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully chose the neotypes to represent the species after the original type was lost.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed the neotypes of the extinct species for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The neotypes decided to have a party to celebrate being chosen as the new representatives of their species.
meanings.sent4: The neotypes stood out like bright stars in the night sky, guiding researchers to the true nature of the species.
meanings.sent5: The neotypes were like ambassadors, carrying the legacy of their species into the future.

meanings.sent1: The company introduced neotypes of smartphones with advanced features.
meanings.sent2: Designers worked hard to create neotypes of cars that would revolutionize the industry.
meanings.sent3: The neotypes of fashion trends were causing a stir in the city.
meanings.sent4: Her innovative ideas were like neotypes, reshaping the way people viewed the world.
meanings.sent5: The neotypes of technology were constantly evolving, pushing boundaries and inspiring creativity.
